text: How does the Gospel of Mark begin?
options: With the ministry of John the Baptist and Jesus' baptism
With the Sermon on the Mount
verseText: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. As it is written in Isaiah the prophet, 'Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way, the voice of one crying in the wilderness: Prepare the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.' John appeared, baptizing in the wilderness and proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins. And all the country of Judea and all Jerusalem were going out to him and were being baptized by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins. (ESV)

text: Mark's Gospel is often characterized by its emphasis on Jesus'...
options: Actions, deeds of power, and servant nature
verseText: And they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath he entered the synagogue and was teaching. And they were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as one who had authority, and not as the scribes. And immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit. And he cried out, 'What have you to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God.' (Mark 1:21-24) For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many. (Mark 10:45) (ESV)

text: What word does Mark frequently use to convey a sense of immediacy and action?
verseText: And when he came up out of the water, immediately he saw the heavens being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove. (Mark 1:10) The Spirit immediately drove him out into the wilderness. (Mark 1:12) And immediately they left their nets and followed him. (Mark 1:18) (ESV)

text: In Mark 2, Jesus heals a paralytic man after his friends do what?
verseText: And they came, bringing to him a paralytic carried by four men. And when they could not get near him because of the crowd, they removed the roof above him, and when they had made an opening, they let down the bed on which the paralytic lay. And when Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”

text: What question does Jesus ask his disciples in Mark 8, leading to Peter's confession?
options: 'Who do the crowds say that I am?' and 'But who do you say that I am?'
verseText: And Jesus went on with his disciples to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. And on the way he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that I am?”... And he asked them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered him, “You are the Christ.”

text: Mark 10:45 describes Jesus' mission as coming not to be served, but to...
options: Serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many
verseText: For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

text: Who is the first human character in Mark's Gospel to declare Jesus as the Son of God?
options: A Roman centurion at the crucifixion
verseText: And when the centurion, who stood facing him, saw that in this way he breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”

text: The 'Messianic Secret' is a theme in Mark where Jesus often tells people or demons...
options: To keep silent about his identity
verseText: And Jesus sternly charged him and sent him away at once, and said to him, 'See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, for a proof to them.' (Mark 1:44) And he strictly ordered them not to make him known. (Mark 3:12) (ESV)

text: How does the earliest and most reliable ending of Mark's Gospel conclude (Mark 16:8)?
options: With the women fleeing the empty tomb in fear and silence
verseText: And they went out and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had seized them, and they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid. (ESV)

text: Mark is traditionally thought to have been a companion of which apostle, possibly basing his Gospel on this apostle's accounts?
verseText: (According to early church fathers like Papias and Irenaeus, Mark recorded the teachings of the apostle Peter, acting as his interpreter.)

text: What happened immediately after Jesus' baptism, according to Mark 1?
options: The Spirit drove him into the wilderness to be tempted
verseText: The Spirit immediately drove him out into the wilderness. (ESV)

text: Who were the first four disciples Jesus called in Mark 1?
options: Philip, Bartholomew, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot
verseText: Passing alongside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea... And going on a little farther, he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother...

text: What amazed the people about Jesus' teaching in the synagogue at Capernaum (Mark 1)?
options: He taught them as one who had authority, unlike the scribes
verseText: And they were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as one who had authority, and not as the scribes.

text: What reason did Jesus give for calling Levi (Matthew) the tax collector to follow him, when criticized for eating with sinners (Mark 2)?
options: 'Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.'
verseText: And when Jesus heard it, he said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.”

text: What did Jesus declare about the Sabbath when his disciples were criticized for plucking grain (Mark 2)?
options: 'The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath. So the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.'
'Only priests can work on the Sabbath'
verseText: And he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath. So the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”

text: After healing the man with the withered hand on the Sabbath, what did the Pharisees immediately plot with the Herodians (Mark 3)?
verseText: The Pharisees went out and immediately held counsel with the Herodians against him, how to destroy him.

text: Who did Jesus' own family think he was when they came to seize him (Mark 3)?
verseText: And when his family heard it, they went out to seize him, for they were saying, “He is out of his mind.”

text: What is the main parable Jesus tells in Mark 4?
options: The Parable of the Good Samaritan
The Parable of the Prodigal Son
verseText: “Listen! Behold, a sower went out to sow. And as he sowed, some seed fell along the path...

text: What miracle does Jesus perform while crossing the Sea of Galilee with his disciples in Mark 4?
options: Catching a fish with a coin
verseText: And he awoke and rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Peace! Be still!” And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

text: What question did Jesus ask his disciples after calming the storm (Mark 4)?
options: 'Why are you so afraid? Have you still no faith?'
'Who do you say that I am?'
verseText: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? Have you still no faith?”

text: In the country of the Gerasenes (Mark 5), Jesus encounters a man possessed by many demons. What name did the demons give?
verseText: And Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He replied, “My name is Legion, for we are many.”

text: What happened to the herd of pigs after Jesus cast the demons into them (Mark 5)?
options: They rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned
verseText: So he gave them permission. And the unclean spirits came out and entered the pigs; and the herd, numbering about two thousand, rushed down the steep bank into the sea and drowned in the sea.

text: What two miracles are intertwined in Mark 5?
options: Calming the storm and walking on water
Healing a blind man and a deaf man
Healing the woman with the discharge of blood and raising Jairus' daughter
verseText: (Jairus asks Jesus to heal his daughter, but on the way, the woman touches Jesus' garment and is healed. Then news comes the daughter died, but Jesus raises her).

text: What phrase did Jesus say to Jairus' daughter when he raised her (Mark 5)?
options: 'Talitha cumi' (Little girl, I say to you, arise)
verseText: Taking her by the hand he said to her, “Talitha cumi,” which means, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”

text: What was the reaction of Jesus' hometown (Nazareth) when he taught there (Mark 6)?
options: They took offense at him and rejected him
They asked him to stay longer
verseText: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.

text: How did John the Baptist die, according to Mark 6?
options: Beheaded by Herod Antipas at the request of Herodias' daughter
verseText: And immediately the king sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. He went and beheaded him in the prison and brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

text: How many men did Jesus feed with five loaves and two fish in Mark 6?
verseText: And those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.

text: What miracle did Jesus perform on the sea after feeding the 5000 (Mark 6)?
verseText: And he saw that they were making headway painfully, for the wind was against them. And about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea. He meant to pass by them,

text: Jesus criticized the Pharisees for nullifying God's word with what (Mark 7)?
verseText: thus making void the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And many such things you do.”

text: What did Jesus declare about all foods, making them clean (Mark 7)?
verseText: since it enters not his heart but his stomach, and is expelled?” (Thus he declared all foods clean.)

text: How many men did Jesus feed with seven loaves and a few small fish in Mark 8?
verseText: And they ate and were satisfied. And they took up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full. And there were about four thousand people.

text: After Peter's confession, what did Jesus begin to teach the disciples openly (Mark 8)?
options: That the Son of Man must suffer, be rejected, be killed, and rise again
verseText: And he began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes and be killed, and after three days rise again.

text: What did Jesus say to Peter after Peter rebuked him for predicting his suffering (Mark 8)?
verseText: But turning and seeing his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of man.”

text: What does Jesus say is required to be his disciple (Mark 8)?
options: To deny oneself, take up one's cross, and follow him
verseText: And calling the crowd to him with his disciples, he said to them, “If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

text: Who appeared with Jesus during the Transfiguration (Mark 9)?
verseText: And there appeared to them Elijah with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.

text: What did the voice from the cloud say during the Transfiguration (Mark 9)?
options: 'This is my beloved Son; listen to him.'
verseText: And a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is my beloved Son; listen to him.”

text: What did Jesus say about divorce in Mark 10?
options: It is permissible for any cause
He affirmed God's original intent ('What God has joined together, let not man separate') and permitted it only due to hardness of heart
verseText: Jesus said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart he wrote you this commandment. But from the beginning of creation, ‘God made them male and female.’ ... What therefore God has joined together, let not man separate.”

text: What did Jesus say to the rich young man who asked about eternal life (Mark 10)?
options: 'Sell everything, give to the poor, and follow me'
verseText: And Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, “You lack one thing: go, sell all that you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.”

text: What did James and John ask Jesus for in Mark 10?
options: To sit at his right and left hand in his glory
verseText: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came up to him and said to him, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask of you.”... And they said to him, “Grant us to sit, one at your right hand and one at your left, in your glory.”

text: Who was the blind beggar healed by Jesus near Jericho (Mark 10)?
verseText: And they came to Jericho. And as he was leaving Jericho with his disciples and a great crowd, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, the son of Timaeus, was sitting by the roadside.

text: What action did Jesus take in the temple after his triumphal entry into Jerusalem (Mark 11)?
options: He drove out those buying and selling and overturned tables
verseText: And they came to Jerusalem. And he entered the temple and began to drive out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and he overturned the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those who sold pigeons.

text: What happened to the fig tree that Jesus cursed for having no fruit (Mark 11)?
options: It withered away to its roots
verseText: And he said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.”... As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away to its roots.

text: In the Parable of the Wicked Tenants (Mark 12), who does the beloved son represent?
verseText: He had still one other, a beloved son. Finally he sent him to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’ But those tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’ And they took him and killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.

text: What did Jesus say was the greatest commandment when asked by a scribe (Mark 12)?
options: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, mind, and strength, and love your neighbor as yourself
verseText: Jesus answered, “The most important is, ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one. And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’ The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

text: Jesus praised a poor widow for putting two small coins into the temple treasury because...
options: She gave all she had to live on
verseText: And he called his disciples to him and said to them, “Truly, I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all those who are contributing to the offering box. For they all contributed out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty has put in everything she had, all she had to live on.”

text: In Mark 13 (Olivet Discourse), Jesus warns about future deception, wars, earthquakes, famines, and what else before the end?
verseText: “But be on your guard. For they will deliver you over to councils, and you will be beaten in synagogues, and you will stand before governors and kings for my sake, to bear witness before them.

text: Who anointed Jesus' head with expensive ointment in Bethany, shortly before his death (Mark 14)?
verseText: And while he was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he was reclining at table, a woman came with an alabaster flask of ointment of pure nard, very costly, and she broke the flask and poured it over his head.

text: During the Last Supper in Mark 14, Jesus predicts that one of the Twelve will do what?
verseText: And as they were reclining at table and eating, Jesus said, “Truly, I say to you, one of you will betray me, one who is eating with me.”

text: Which three disciples did Jesus take with him to pray in Gethsemane (Mark 14)?
options: Simon the Zealot, Thaddaeus, James the Less
verseText: And he took with him Peter and James and John, and began to be greatly distressed and troubled.

text: What did the disciples repeatedly fail to do while Jesus prayed in Gethsemane (Mark 14)?
verseText: And he came and found them sleeping, and he said to Peter, “Simon, are you asleep? Could you not watch one hour?”... And again he came and found them sleeping... And he came the third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest?

text: What charge did the high priest find Jesus guilty of after Jesus affirmed he was the Christ, the Son of the Blessed (Mark 14)?
verseText: Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?” And Jesus said, “I am, and you will see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.” And the high priest tore his garments and said, “What further witnesses do we need? You have heard his blasphemy.

text: Who did Pilate release to the crowd instead of Jesus (Mark 15)?
verseText: And among the rebels in prison, who had committed murder in the insurrection, there was a man called Barabbas... So Pilate, wishing to satisfy the crowd, released for them Barabbas, and having scourged Jesus, he delivered him to be crucified.

text: What did the soldiers mockingly place on Jesus' head before the crucifixion (Mark 15)?
verseText: And they clothed him in a purple cloak, and twisting together a crown of thorns, they put it on him.

text: What time was it when they crucified Jesus, according to Mark 15?
verseText: And it was the third hour when they crucified him.

text: What cry did Jesus utter from the cross around the ninth hour, according to Mark 15?
options: 'Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?' (My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?)
'Into your hands I commit my spirit'
verseText: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”

text: Which women are mentioned as watching the crucifixion from a distance (Mark 15)?
options: Mary the mother of Jesus, Martha
Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome
verseText: There were also women looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome.

text: Who asked Pilate for the body of Jesus and buried it (Mark 15)?
verseText: Joseph of Arimathea, a respected member of the council, who was also himself looking for the kingdom of God, took courage and went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus... And Joseph bought a linen shroud, and taking him down, wrapped him in the linen shroud and laid him in a tomb...

text: Who did the women find at the tomb on the first day of the week (Mark 16)?
options: A young man in a white robe
verseText: And entering the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, dressed in a white robe, and they were alarmed.

text: What message did the young man give the women at the tomb (Mark 16)?
options: 'Go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going before you to Galilee. There you will see him.'
verseText: And he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has risen; he is not here. See the place where they laid him. But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going before you to Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.”

text: When Jesus healed a leper early in his ministry, what did he strictly charge the man to do, which the man disobeyed?
options: Offer the proper sacrifice and tell no one
Go show himself to the priests
verseText: And said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, for a proof to them.”

text: After appointing the twelve apostles, what specific authority did Jesus give them?
options: To preach and to cast out demons
verseText: And he appointed twelve (whom he also named apostles) so that they might be with him and he might send them out to preach and have authority to cast out demons.

text: When scribes from Jerusalem accused Jesus of casting out demons by the prince of demons, what analogy did Jesus use to refute them?
options: A kingdom or house divided against itself
verseText: And he called them to him and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan? If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand. And if a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand. And if Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but is coming to an end.

text: In the Parable of the Sower, what does the seed sown on rocky ground represent?
options: Those who hear the word but Satan snatches it away
Those who hear the word but are choked by worldly cares
Those who receive the word with joy but fall away when tribulation comes
Those who hear, accept, and bear fruit
verseText: And these are the ones sown on rocky ground: the ones who, when they hear the word, immediately receive it with joy. And they have no root in themselves, but endure for a while; then, when tribulation or persecution arises on account of the word, immediately they fall away.

text: What small seed did Jesus use in a parable to illustrate the surprising growth of the Kingdom of God?
verseText: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when sown on the ground, is the smallest of all the seeds on earth, yet when it is sown it grows up and becomes larger than all the garden plants and puts out large branches, so that the birds of the air can make nests in its shade.”

text: After Jesus cast the 'Legion' of demons out of the man, what did the man request, and what did Jesus tell him to do instead?
options: He asked for money; Jesus told him to work
He asked to follow Jesus; Jesus told him to go home and tell his people what the Lord had done
He asked for healing; Jesus told him his faith made him well
He asked to join the disciples; Jesus told him to wait
verseText: As he was getting into the boat, the man who had been possessed with demons begged him that he might be with him. And he did not permit him but said to him, “Go home to your friends and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.”

text: Why was Jesus unable to do many mighty works in his hometown of Nazareth?
verseText: And he could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people and healed them. And he marveled because of their unbelief.

text: When Jesus sent out the twelve disciples, what were they instructed to take with them?
options: Only a staff; no bread, no bag, no money
verseText: He charged them to take nothing for their journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in their belts— but to wear sandals and not put on two tunics.

text: After the feeding of the 5000, the disciples were straining at the oars against the wind. What did Jesus intend to do as he walked on the water towards them?
verseText: And he saw that they were making headway painfully, for the wind was against them. And about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea. He meant to pass by them,

text: Why did the disciples' hearts become hardened after the feeding of the 5000 and seeing Jesus walk on water?
options: They did not understand about the loaves
They were too focused on the storm
verseText: for they did not understand about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

text: Jesus declared that defilement comes not from external things like unwashed hands or unclean foods, but from what?
options: What comes out of a person, from within the heart
verseText: there is nothing outside a person that by going into him can defile him, but the things that come out of a person are what defile him... What comes out of a person is what defiles him. For from within, out of the heart of man, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery, coveting, wickedness, deceit, sensuality, envy, slander, pride, foolishness. All these evil things come from within, and they defile a person.”

text: In the region of Tyre, a Syrophoenician woman begged Jesus to heal her daughter. What was Jesus' initial, challenging response involving 'children's bread' and 'dogs'?
options: 'Let the children be fed first, for it is not right to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.'
verseText: And he said to her, “Let the children be fed first, for it is not right to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.”

text: How did the Syrophoenician woman respond cleverly to Jesus' analogy about bread and dogs, leading to her daughter's healing?
options: 'Yes, Lord; yet even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.'
verseText: But she answered him, “Yes, Lord; yet even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.”

text: When Jesus healed a deaf man with a speech impediment in the Decapolis region, what Aramaic word did he use, meaning 'Be opened'?
verseText: And looking up to heaven, he sighed and said to him, “Ephphatha,” that is, “Be opened.”

text: After feeding the 4000, the Pharisees came and asked Jesus for a sign from heaven. How did Jesus respond?
options: He sighed deeply and said no sign would be given to that generation
He showed them the leftover bread
verseText: The Pharisees came and began to argue with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven to test him. And he sighed deeply in his spirit and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly, I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation.”

text: Jesus warned his disciples to beware of the 'leaven' of which two groups?
verseText: And he cautioned them, saying, “Watch out; beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.”

text: When Jesus healed a blind man at Bethsaida, the healing happened in stages. What did the man see after the first touch?
verseText: And he looked up and said, “I see people, but they look like trees, walking.”

text: Jesus said, 'For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake and the gospel's will...'
verseText: For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake and the gospel's will save it.

text: What did Jesus say would happen if someone is ashamed of him and his words in this adulterous and sinful generation?
options: The Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in glory
verseText: For whoever is ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him will the Son of Man also be ashamed when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”

text: Before the Transfiguration, Jesus promised that some standing there would not taste death until they saw what?
options: The kingdom of God after it has come with power
verseText: And he said to them, “Truly, I say to you, there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God after it has come with power.”

text: After the Transfiguration, the disciples asked Jesus about Elijah. Jesus confirmed Elijah comes first to restore all things, but also spoke of what?
options: How the Son of Man must suffer and be treated with contempt
verseText: And he said to them, “Elijah does come first to restore all things. And how is it written of the Son of Man that he should suffer many things and be treated with contempt? But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they did to him whatever they pleased, as it is written of him.”

text: When the disciples could not cast out a demon from a boy, what did Jesus say was required?
verseText: And he said to them, “This kind cannot be driven out by anything but prayer.” [Some manuscripts add 'and fasting']

text: The disciples argued about who was the greatest. How did Jesus define true greatness?
options: Being last of all and servant of all
verseText: And he sat down and called the twelve. And he said to them, “If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”

text: When John told Jesus they had stopped someone casting out demons in Jesus' name because he wasn't part of their group, what was Jesus' response?
options: 'Do not stop him, for no one who does a mighty work in my name will be able soon afterward to speak evil of me.'
verseText: But Jesus said, “Do not stop him, for no one who does a mighty work in my name will be able soon afterward to speak evil of me. For the one who is not against us is for us.

text: Jesus used graphic language about cutting off a hand or foot or plucking out an eye if it causes sin, emphasizing what?
options: The extreme measures needed to avoid sin and hell (Gehenna)
verseText: And if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than with two hands to go to hell, to the unquenchable fire... (similar for foot and eye)

text: Jesus said everyone will be 'salted with fire'. What did he immediately command the disciples to do?
options: Have salt in themselves and be at peace with one another
verseText: For everyone will be salted with fire. Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, how will you make it salty again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

text: When people brought children to Jesus for him to touch, how did the disciples react, and how did Jesus respond to the disciples?
options: Disciples welcomed them; Jesus taught them
Disciples ignored them; Jesus ignored them
Disciples rebuked the people; Jesus became indignant and welcomed the children
Disciples blessed them; Jesus joined in
verseText: And they were bringing children to him that he might touch them, and the disciples rebuked them. But when Jesus saw it, he was indignant and said to them, “Let the children come to me; do not hinder them, for to such belongs the kingdom of God.

text: What did Jesus say is necessary to receive the kingdom of God?
verseText: Truly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child shall not enter it.”

text: After the rich young man went away sad, Jesus commented on the difficulty of the rich entering the kingdom. What analogy did he use?
options: A wide gate and a narrow gate
A sheep through the eye of a needle
A camel going through the eye of a needle
verseText: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”

text: When the disciples were amazed at the difficulty for the rich to be saved, Jesus said, 'With man it is impossible, but not with God. For...'
verseText: Jesus looked at them and said, “With man it is impossible, but not with God. For all things are possible with God.”

text: Peter mentioned that the disciples had left everything to follow Jesus. What did Jesus promise to those who leave things behind for his sake and the gospel?
options: A hundredfold now in this time (houses, family, lands) with persecutions, and eternal life in the age to come
verseText: Jesus said, “Truly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or lands, for my sake and for the gospel, who will not receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions, and in the age to come eternal life. But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”

text: On the way to Jerusalem, Jesus predicted his passion for the third time. What specific details did he include about his betrayal and condemnation?
options: He would be praised by the leaders
He would be betrayed to chief priests and scribes, condemned, and handed over to the Gentiles
He would establish an earthly kingdom immediately
verseText: “See, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn him to death and deliver him over to the Gentiles. And they will mock him and spit on him, and flog him and kill him. And after three days he will rise.”

text: What did Jesus say the 'cup' he would drink and the 'baptism' he would undergo represented, when responding to James and John's request?
verseText: Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, or to be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?” And they said to him, “We are able.” And Jesus said to them, “The cup that I drink you will drink, and with the baptism with which I am baptized, you will be baptized...

text: How did Jesus contrast the rulers of the Gentiles with the way leadership should be among his followers?
options: Gentile rulers serve; disciples should rule
Gentile rulers lord it over them; disciples should be servants and slaves
Gentile rulers are elected; disciples are appointed
Gentile rulers build empires; disciples build churches
verseText: And Jesus called them to him and said to them, “You know that those who are considered rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them. But it shall not be so among you. But whoever would be great among you must be your servant, and whoever would be first among you must be slave of all.

text: What did blind Bartimaeus cry out repeatedly as Jesus passed by Jericho?
options: 'Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!'
verseText: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!” And many rebuked him, telling him to be silent. But he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

text: What did Bartimaeus do immediately after Jesus healed him?
options: He followed Jesus on the way
He showed himself to the priests
verseText: And Jesus said to him, “Go your way; your faith has made you well.” And immediately he recovered his sight and followed him on the way.

text: For the Triumphal Entry, Jesus instructed his disciples to find what specific animal?
options: A colt that had never been ridden
verseText: saying to them, “Go into the village in front of you, and immediately as you enter it you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it.

text: What did the crowds shout as Jesus rode into Jerusalem?
options: 'Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!'
verseText: And those who went before and those who followed were shouting, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!”

text: Why did Jesus curse the fig tree?
options: He was hungry and it had no fruit, only leaves
verseText: On the following day, when they came from Bethany, he was hungry. And seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to see if he could find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs. And he said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.”

text: When Jesus cleansed the temple, what reason did he give, quoting Scripture?
options: 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations', but they made it a 'den of robbers'
'Zeal for your house will consume me'
verseText: And he was teaching them and saying to them, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it a den of robbers.”

text: After seeing the withered fig tree, Jesus taught about faith and prayer. What did he say is necessary when praying?
options: Believing you have received it, and forgiving others
verseText: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours. And whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father also who is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.”

text: When the chief priests, scribes, and elders questioned Jesus' authority, how did Jesus respond?
options: He quoted scripture about the Messiah
He asked them a counter-question about the authority of John's baptism
verseText: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question; answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things. Was the baptism of John from heaven or from man? Answer me.”

text: Why were the religious leaders afraid to say John the Baptist's authority was from men?
options: They feared the crowd, who believed John was a prophet
They didn't want to offend Herod
verseText: But shall we say, ‘From man’?”—they were afraid of the people, for they all held that John really was a prophet.

text: In the Parable of the Wicked Tenants, what did the tenants do to the owner's servants and finally his son?
options: Beat some, killed others, and finally killed the son
verseText: And they took him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed... Then he sent another... they killed him... He had still one other, a beloved son. Finally he sent him... But those tenants... took him and killed him...

text: After telling the Parable of the Wicked Tenants, Jesus quoted a scripture about the stone the builders rejected becoming what?
verseText: Have you not read this Scripture: “‘The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone; this was the Lord's doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

text: Pharisees and Herodians tried to trap Jesus with a question about paying taxes to whom?
verseText: Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not? Should we pay them, or should we not?”

text: How did Jesus answer the question about paying taxes to Caesar?
options: 'Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's'
verseText: Jesus said to them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.” And they marveled at him.

text: The Sadducees, who denied the resurrection, posed a hypothetical question about a woman married sequentially to seven brothers. Whose wife would she be in the resurrection?
options: Jesus said they misunderstand; people won't marry in the resurrection
verseText: Jesus said to them, “Is this not the reason you are wrong, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God? For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

text: How did Jesus argue for the resurrection against the Sadducees, using the story of Moses at the burning bush?
options: He pointed out God is the God of the living (Abraham, Isaac, Jacob), not the dead
He spoke of his own future resurrection
verseText: And as for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? He is not God of the dead, but of the living. You are quite wrong.”

text: After Jesus answered the scribe about the greatest commandment, what did the scribe acknowledge about loving God and neighbor?
options: It was less important than sacrifice
It is much more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices
verseText: And the scribe said to him, “You are right, Teacher. You have truly said that he is one, and there is no other besides him. And to love him with all the heart and with all the understanding and with all the strength, and to love one's neighbor as oneself, is much more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

text: What did Jesus say to the scribe who answered wisely about the greatest commandment?
options: 'You are not far from the kingdom of God'
verseText: And when Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And after that no one dared to ask him any more questions.

text: Jesus questioned the scribes' teaching about the Christ (Messiah) being the Son of David, by quoting David himself calling the Messiah what?
verseText: And as Jesus taught in the temple, he said, “How can the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David? David himself, in the Holy Spirit, declared, “‘The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand, until I put your enemies under your feet.’” David himself calls him Lord. So how is he his son?”

text: Jesus warned his disciples to beware of the scribes who liked public recognition and honor but did what?
options: Devoured widows' houses and made long prayers for pretense
verseText: And in his teaching he said, “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes and like greetings in the marketplaces and have the best seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at feasts, who devour widows' houses and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive the greater condemnation.”

text: In the Olivet Discourse, what did Jesus say must happen before the end comes?
options: The gospel must first be proclaimed to all nations
Israel must become a world power
verseText: And the gospel must first be proclaimed to all nations.

text: Jesus warned about the 'abomination of desolation' standing where it ought not to be. What did he advise those in Judea to do when they see this?
verseText: “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where he ought not to be (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

text: Regarding the timing of his return, what did Jesus say about the day and hour?
options: It would be revealed to the disciples
It would happen within their lifetime
Only the Father knows; not even the angels or the Son
It could be calculated from signs
verseText: “But concerning that day or that hour, no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

text: What command did Jesus repeatedly give his disciples concerning the end times and his return?
verseText: Be on guard, keep awake... Therefore stay awake... And what I say to you I say to all: Stay awake.”

text: Why did the chief priests and scribes initially want to avoid arresting Jesus during the Feast of Passover?
options: They feared a riot among the people
verseText: It was now two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how to arrest him by stealth and kill him, for they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar from the people.”

text: How did Jesus defend the woman who anointed him with expensive ointment against the disciples' criticism?
options: He said she had wealth to spare
He said she did a beautiful thing, anointing his body beforehand for burial
He rebuked the disciples for greed
He said the ointment wasn't that expensive
verseText: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a beautiful thing to me... She has done what she could; she has anointed my body beforehand for burial.

text: What did Judas Iscariot agree to do for the chief priests?
verseText: Then Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests in order to betray him to them. And when they heard it, they were glad and promised to give him money. And he sought an opportunity to betray him.

text: During the Last Supper, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, saying what?
verseText: And as they were eating, he took bread, and after blessing it broke it and gave it to them, and said, “Take; this is my body.”

text: When Jesus took the cup during the Last Supper, what did he call it?
options: 'This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.'
verseText: And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks he gave it to them, and they all drank of it. And he said to them, “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.

text: Jesus predicted that Peter would deny him how many times before the rooster crowed twice?
verseText: And Jesus said to him, “Truly, I tell you, this very night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”

text: In Gethsemane, Jesus prayed, 'Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Remove this cup from me. Yet...'
options: '...not what I will, but what you will.'
verseText: And he said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Remove this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”

text: What sign did Judas use to identify Jesus to the armed crowd that came to arrest him?
verseText: Now the betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I will kiss is the man. Seize him and lead him away under guard.” And when he came, he went up to him at once and said, “Rabbi!” And he kissed him.

text: During Jesus' arrest, what did one of the bystanders do?
options: Drew his sword and cut off the ear of the high priest's servant
verseText: But one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.

text: Who fled away naked, leaving his linen cloth behind, when Jesus was arrested?
verseText: And a young man followed him, with nothing but a linen cloth about his body. And they seized him, but he left the linen cloth and ran away naked.

text: During the trial before the Sanhedrin, many gave false testimony against Jesus, but what was the problem with their testimony?
verseText: For many bore false witness against him, but their testimony did not agree... Yet even about this their testimony did not agree.

text: What specific claim did the false witnesses make about Jesus and the temple?
options: He planned to burn it down
He said, 'I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another, not made with hands.'
He claimed to be the High Priest
verseText: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another, not made with hands.’”

text: While Jesus was on trial, Peter was warming himself by the fire. What happened when a servant girl identified him as being with Jesus?
verseText: And as Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came, and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with the Nazarene, Jesus.” But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you mean.”

text: After Peter denied Jesus for the third time, what happened immediately that caused him to break down and weep?
options: The rooster crowed the second time
verseText: And immediately the rooster crowed a second time. And Peter remembered how Jesus had said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And he broke down and wept.

text: When Pilate asked Jesus, 'Are you the King of the Jews?', how did Jesus reply?
options: 'My kingdom is not of this world'
'Do you ask this of your own accord?'
verseText: And Pilate asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?” And he answered him, “You have said so.”

text: Despite the chief priests accusing Jesus of many things before Pilate, how did Jesus respond?
verseText: And Pilate again asked him, “Have you no answer to make? See how many charges they bring against you.” But Jesus made no further answer, so that Pilate was amazed.

text: What was Pilate's custom during the Passover feast?
options: To release one prisoner whom the crowd requested
To give extra rations to the soldiers
verseText: Now at the feast he used to release for them one prisoner for whom they asked.

text: What did the soldiers do to Jesus after Pilate handed him over to be crucified?
options: Mocked him, dressed him in purple, put on a crown of thorns, saluted him as 'King of the Jews', and struck him
verseText: And the soldiers led him away inside the palace... And they clothed him in a purple cloak, and twisting together a crown of thorns, they put it on him. And they began to salute him, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they were striking his head with a reed and spitting on him and kneeling down in homage to him. And when they had mocked him, they stripped him of the purple cloak and put his own clothes on him. And they led him out to crucify him.

text: Who was compelled to carry Jesus' cross?
verseText: And they compelled a passerby, Simon of Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to carry his cross.

text: What did they offer Jesus to drink at Golgotha, which he refused?
verseText: And they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.

text: What did the soldiers do with Jesus' garments after crucifying him?
verseText: And they crucified him and divided his garments among them, casting lots for them, to decide what each should take.

text: What inscription was placed over Jesus' head on the cross?
verseText: And the inscription of the charge against him read, “The King of the Jews.”

text: Who mocked Jesus while he was on the cross, saying, 'He saved others; he cannot save himself'?
options: Only the thieves crucified with him
Passersby, chief priests, scribes, and those crucified with him
verseText: And those who passed by derided him... So also the chief priests with the scribes mocked him to one another, saying, “He saved others; he cannot save himself. Let the Christ, the King of Israel, come down now from the cross that we may see and believe.” Those who were crucified with him also reviled him.

text: What supernatural event occurred from the sixth hour until the ninth hour during the crucifixion?
verseText: And when the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

text: What happened in the temple at the moment Jesus died?
options: The curtain of the temple was torn in two, from top to bottom
verseText: And the curtain of the temple was torn in two, from top to bottom.

text: Why did Joseph of Arimathea ask for Jesus' body?
options: He was instructed by the disciples
He was a respected council member looking for the kingdom of God
verseText: Joseph of Arimathea, a respected member of the council, who was also himself looking for the kingdom of God, took courage and went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.

text: Why were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome going to the tomb early on the first day of the week?
options: To anoint Jesus' body with spices
verseText: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices, so that they might go and anoint him.

text: What concern did the women express as they approached the tomb?
options: Who would roll away the stone for them
verseText: And they were saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance of the tomb?”

text: According to the young man in the tomb, where would the disciples see the risen Jesus?
verseText: But go, tell his disciples and Peter that he is going before you to Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.”
